data.title: The Best Tips For Wyomingites Buying A Pillow
data.meta_description: You're probably sleeping on the wrong pillow.
data.text:
A good night's sleep is important for functioning throughout the day. I can always tell when I didn't sleep well, and so can the people around me.

I get irritable, have trouble paying attention, react slower, feel sluggish and tired, and don't feel like talking to people. I'm sure you've noticed some of the same symptoms.

One reason you may be getting crappy sleep is because you have a crappy pillow. Yep, that pillow you can't wait to hit at night may not be the proper one.

That's heavy information, right?

I had never heard of proper pillow-picking etiquette either. Then I started researching and found everything you never knew you needed to know about pillow picking. The site I chose to do the research is A.A.R.P.

Sleep experts suggest that you figure out the answer to these questions.

Do you like a soft or a firm pillow?

When you fall asleep, what is your starting sleep position?

Do you sweat at night?

Do you have allergies?

What kind of sleeper are you?

Stomach - You'll want a thin or extra-soft pillow to keep your neck from arching backward too far.

Side Sleeper - Choosing a thicker, medium-firm pillow style is best.

Back Sleeper - Soft, flat pillow to align your back and spine.

Position switching Sleeper - A pillow that allows you to change the height and firmness by adding stuffing.

You have plenty of materials to choose from when looking for a pillow.

Microfiber - Soft

Feather - Soft

Down - Soft

Memory Foam - Firm

Latex- Firm

Kapok - Soft fiber that is often combined with shredded memory foam

Even a large selection of special pillows may be an option.

Cooling Technology - Helps people fall asleep and stay asleep longer.

Allergen-free - If you have allergies or asthma, you'll want to avoid down, feathers, and latex. Find a pillow that has been treated to prevent this that can trigger you.

Wedge - If you snore, the wedge can help reduce snoring, sleep apnea issues, and acid reflux.

Music - Some people like to listen to music or sounds. These pillows are equipped with technology that allows you to play audio from them.
